title: mum who thought shed met
story: Mum who thought shed met dream man conned her out of le savings and cost her jobSunita Brittain, , was convinced "Michael Anderson" - an alias used by the fraudster - was the love of her le - and fell for him after meeting online in a case similar to the "Tinder Swindler" on NetflixA mum who thought she met her dream man has revealed how he turned out to be a Tinder Swindler Image: Sunita Brittain   SWNSByLauren BeavisLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA mum who thought she met her dream man has revealed how he turned out to be a Tinder Swindler - and conned her out of her le savings and cost her her job. Sunita Brittain, , was convinced Michael Anderson was the love of her le - and fell for him after meeting online. He told her he was a successful businessman and multi-millionaire working as a global engineer and cryptocurrency analyst. They exchanged thousands of messages and photos, and he even told her he loved her and wanted to spend his le with her - even though they had never met.But, in chilling echoes of the hit Netflix show The Tinder Swindler, he then began asking for money. He said he needed £, to get him out of a jail in Northern Cyprus – following an accident at his engineering project out there. Michael pleaded with her for the money in so many calls she even lost a job as a teaching assistant for keeping her phone on her during work. She then sent the money to an account for what Michael said was his lawyer. aposMichaelapos claimed he needed the money for flights to Britain. Sunita then realised something was up and called her bank and told them she feared she had been scammed - and they told her they had frozen the account. aposMichaelapos then began ringing her making threats, harassing her and told her he would find out where she lived. Sunita met him online in January but has now not heard from him for a few weeks - and has no ideasheaposll get her money back.Sunita, mother-of-two from Harworth, Notts, said: aposaposMy story parallels with the Tinder Swindler, it is crazy. I was so vulnerable, I had just come out of a loveless marriage, was going through a orce and was just craving some kind of attention to make me feel wanted again. aposaposHe started talking to me in a very intimate way and made me feel like the only woman in the whole world. “He was telling me things that you imagine in a fairytale, with that happily ever after ending.”She met her scammer on the Facebook dating site ‘Facebook Dating ❤️’ on January .‘Michael Anderson’, who said he was the owner of a multi-million-pound global engineering company and cryptocurrency analyst, initiated a conversation with Sunita.Michael swtly asked for her number, and the pair exchanged thousands of messages on WhatsApp, with Michael initiating heavy conversations.Michael told Sunita he was born on the exact same day as her and was adopted - like her - by his parents from Zurich. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  On January , Sunita and Michael chatted on the phone for the first time and she was convinced of her fraudsteraposs feelings. Sunita, whose children are  and  years old, said there were a few red flags that she admits “dismissing” because of her feelings for Michael. One was his refusal to show his face on video call. “I found it strange why he never wanted to Facetime”, she admitted. “He said he was camera shy – the one time I tried, the image from his side was blurry and he looked about  years older than his pictures.” Michael conjured up his elaborate ruse on the  January, when he told Sunita he had to go immediately to one of his engineering projects out in Northern Cyprus. Sunita said: “Michael told me he had to rush out there as there had been a ‘tragic accident’ and he had to provide a huge pay-out of £, to one of the families. “Three days later, he told me the Cyprus Police are holding him in custody. “He continued to say how much he loved me and how we will be together when this is all over. He called himself aposThe Kingapos and me aposThe Queenapos and told me how much he felt the connection of great love.”Mr Anderson instructed Sunita to make three separate bank transfers to what he claimed was his lawyeraposs offshore bank account. Sunita logged on to his fake account on HorizoGlobal – which has no link to Horizon Global - she later discovered that HorizoGlobale was a fake bank - but where she could see Michael had over £million in his fabricated bank account. He told her to transfer three separate transactions to his lawyer – two of £, and one of £, – which got rejected. “I could see the money in his account going down, it was so realistic and didn’t even cross my mind that it was a fake website, she said. “He kept telling me the lines were down and there was no Wi, so I had to keep transferring the money in instalments because he was unable to do it himself. On January , Sunita received a fake email from aposHorizoGlobalapos saying Mr Anderson cannot transfer any more money because of “security reasons”. The email was alerting her they have frozen Michael’s assets until they can see him face-to-face in their Head Office based in Los Angeles. Sunita said: “I got calls from Michael and he was starting to stress out – saying he would have to sell his bitcoin and borrow money off his lawyer. “He told me to send the bank my ID and lie saying I was his finance. “He said he would rather pay the compensation rather than lose his trading business license and needed to buy flights to come home back to me. “He started guilt-tripping me, begging me to help him – saying he would pay me back.” That was the moment Sunita made the transaction of £, to the bank account of a second fake identity this time a aposMr David Gana’sapos bank account – Mr Anderson’s lawyer based in Coventry. Michael sent Sunita screenshots of his flights back to Doncaster on January , where she was planning to pick him up from before going straight to LA on the Sunday so they could “prove Michael’s identity for his offshore bank account”. Sunita said: “My suitcase was packed and I was so excited. “I couldn’t get hold of Michael all afternoon, and suddenly I received a call from one of his ‘lawyers’ saying Michael was arrested by police officials on his flight home for ‘tax evasion’, his phone had been taken away and he was stuck in Police Custody. “I rung my best friend, telling her about everything that happened and how I was supposed to be going to America. “She asked me how much I had given him so I told her. “That is when she said, ‘Sunita. Wake up. You’ve been scammed – you have kids to think of, he could’ve killed youapos. “She could tell right away and that is when the penny dropped and I knew that I had been scammed. “The whole thing may seem desperate but when you’re on your own, these scammers play with your mind and people don’t understand that. “When you isolate yourself from people, you can be blind-sighted by somebody getting into your head.” Sunita immediately notied her bank, who froze her account and got in contact with the Action Fraud Police Unit. Michael has since been harassing Sunita, phoning her to unfreeze her bank account. He suddenly turned nasty and started threatening me that he would find out where I live Sunita said. Heaposs been calling me on dferent numbers and shouting, itaposs terrying and just horric. On Feb  I opened my blinds and saw a suspicious van parked right outside my house so I immediately called the police. I have two children and nowhere  to go and just want to stop this from happening to anyone . A Meta spokeswoman issued the following guidance for staying safe on Facebook Dating:We recommend that all users read our dating safety tips to help keep themselves safe when using Facebook Dating. Please see here. We encourage users to watch out for scams - some warning signs we outline within our dating safety tips include the following. If a scammer: Wants to leave Facebook Dating immediately and use personal email or IM to chat Claims to be in love very quickly to persuade you to talk with them Plans to visit, but claims that something bad happened and plans get cancelled Scammers may try to get you to wire money or send gts. They might ask for money to cover travel, medical emergencies, hotel bills, hospital bills or visas. Any online love interest that asks for money is likely a scammer. Users should never respond to any requests to send money, wire transfer money or make a donation. We recommend contacting your bank and local law enforcement right awayyou think youaposve sent money to a scammer and report anyone who asks you to send money.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON BanksLoveBitcoinFraud" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: queen only answers phone two
story: Queen only answers her phone to two people - and Charles isnt one of themA royal commentator has revealed some of the Queens dialling habits, like what phone she uses and the only two people that she will answer to when they call herThe Queen has her own personal phone too Image: BUCKINGHAM PALACE AFP via GettyByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen is one of the most important women in the world, so we expect that she gets a lot of calls with plans to meet with important people and events to attend.However, when someone rings the royal residence, itaposs not the Queen who picks up the phone, itaposs a member of staff.If Her Majesty wants to talk to people directly, she has access to her own personal smartphone - a Samsung, apparently. Royal commentator Jonathan Sacerdoti shared some of the Queenaposs dialling habits in a chat with US presenter Christina Garibaldi, where he revealed there are only two people that she answers to - and neither are her sons.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm.Click here to sign up.He said that the Queen uses a Samsung which features anti-hacker encryption by MI and that sheaposll only answer the phone to her daughter Princess Anne and her racing manager John Warren. As for her other three kids - Prince Charles, Prince Andrew and Prince Edward - maybe theyaposll have better luck calling her landline... Sacerdoti told Garibaldi: Apparently the Queen has two people who she speaks to the most on her phones.He continued by saying: She also apparently has a mobile phone which is said to be Samsung packed with anti-hacker encryption by MI so nobody can hack into her phone. But the two people she phones the most are said to be her daughter Princess Anne and her racing manager John Warren. And particularlyJohn calls, she answers, Sacerdoti added. He explained: He is the son-in-law of the Queen’s friend, the late Earl of Carnarvon and his home was Highclere castle in Berkshire which viewers of TV may know better as Downton Abbey. Warren is considered one of the world’s leading horsemen and oversees all of the Queen’s racing and breeding interests.Her royal majesty has been involved with horses for over  years and first attended the Royal Ascot in  aged  years old, according to Britain Magazine. story: Striking image shows , dogs rescued by mother and daughterSharon and Nadine Weir have helped to rehome around , dogs since launching their home-run animal rescue Paws and People - and have shared a picture collage of their successThe collage shows , dogs who have been rehomed thanks to Paws and People Image: Paws and PeopleByJilly BeattiePaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsFinding loving owners is one of the many challenging facing homeless dogs - but two women have been doing their bit to help out. Mother-daughter duo Sharon and Nadine Weir have rehomed about , dogs after launching their home-run animal rescue, Paws and People. The charity in Banbridge, Northern Ireland, works to rehome the countryaposs most vulnerable pets who find themselves in dire need, with many taking to the streets after being rejected or neglected by their previous owners.Celebrating their success so far, Sharon and Nadine have shared a striking image showing , dogs they have rescued and rehomed since , reports BelfastLive. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Sharon said: We first opened our home to animals in , and have been a registered charity since December .Our mission is to rescue, rehabilitate and re-home unwanted and abused animals, to give animals that second chance at le. In response to their incredible image, owners who have adopted a dog through Paws and People have shared their thanks to the team. One user said: Thank you for being there. I wouldnapost have my beautul Eva without you. While another user added: We wouldnapost have had our beautul furbabiesit wasnapost for the work you two do. Thank you girls. A third said: Thank you for our Bailey boots. Sheaposs a great girl who has fitted in perfectly.If you would like to help Sharon and Nadine through donation, click here and follow the link.Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-arctic-blast-"Met Office: Windy conditions forecast for across the UKByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Brits are faced with a freezing start to Tuesday with temperatures dropping to -C before gale force winds up to mph are predicted by the Met Office.It has been a cold start to March and the low temperatures are continuing for the next couple of days before the mercury rises on Thursday. Freezing temperatures, though, this month means that odds have been slashed on it being the coldest March ever, moving to  .Alex Apati of Ladbrokes said: Thereaposs every chance this month breaks records on the weather front with the odds continuing to drastically tumble.Going into Tuesday and it will be a cold but bright start with a low pressure front coming in from the Atlantic competing with high pressure from the continent.  Met Office forecaster Clare Nasir said: “Tuesday will be a windy day but bright for some and dry for many before rain arrives across more western areas.” She continued: “Winds towards the north west as well as the north east could actually touch near gale force for a time, afflicting shower or two can’t be ruled outtowards the far south west. But inland where that cloud breaks up temperatures fall quite quickly so expect a quite widespread frost,lowest temperatures in northern counties of England, particularly rural spots, central parts of Scotland coming in at around -C or -C. Despite a frosty start it will be a bright one, certainly across central Scotland you will see some bright weathernot some sunshine.  Still that driving wind coming in from the south though. Northern Ireland seeing more in the way of cloud and some patchy cloud for Wales as well as the West Country but a crisp start to the day further east with some sunshine. Then we watch through Tuesday as the brighter and drier weather becomes confined to central and eastern parts of Scotland as well as England as the cloud thickens from the west and eventually we will see some rain arrive across Cornwall as well as Devon, Pembrokeshire, Northern Ireland and by the end of the day western Scotland.  This rain will be heavy at times, coupled with the wind which will touch gale force particularly across the north west of Scotland, gusts along the Western Isles could actually peak at mph so a windy day, a lively day but a bright one. There is set to be more heavy rain and wind for Wednesday while the outlook remains unsettled for the rest of the week but Thursday is likely to be the warmest day with temperatures possibly getting up to the mid teens. BBC weather forecaster Matt Taylor said Temperatures could rise further as we go into Thursday, as you can see the low pressure bands ganging up but fizzling out when they run into the high pressure system. So it does look as though Thursday is the driest brightest day of the week. UK forecast for the next  days Bright in the east, rain and strong winds in west. Today: Dry and rather cold with sunny spells, although cloudier in the west with a band of rain moving eastwards, followed by sunshine and showers for Northern Ireland and southwestern areas later. Windy with coastal gales in the west. Tonight: Band of cloud and rain moving across remaining areas, heavy in the northwest, but little rain in the east. Clear spells following, but rain, some heavy for Northern Ireland later. Wednesday: Dry, bright and breezy in east after low cloud clears. Cloud and rain in far west moving into other western areas, heavy in northwest with some snow over hills later. Outlook for Thursday to Saturday: Cloudy and windy with rain at times in the west. Drier with sunshine in the southeast, warm in the sunshine, but rain arriving Friday. Showers Saturday with further rain later. title: well known tv couple unrecognisable
story: Well-known TV couple unrecognisable from unearthed s wedding photo to mark  yearsThe sentimental snap was shared by the couple to mark their th wedding anniversary but it left many saying they looked unrecognisable compared to todayThe cute snap was shared by the well known TV couple to celebrate their anniversaryByJoe Smith:,  Mar |comments A throwback wedding snap from the s left fans of this star couple open-mouthed after it came to light on Facebook. The sentimental snap was shared by the couple to mark their th wedding anniversary but it left many saying they looked unrecognisable compared to today.Buy canny fans might be able to make out the smiling faces of TV stars Sue and Noel Radford of the hit show “ Kids and Counting”.But the wedding pic, posted to commemorate their anniversary in , shows the couple looking totally dferent, so you’d be forgivenyou couldn’t make them out.Sue posted the touching image with the caption:  years ago today I married my soulmate.  Who would have thought  years later weaposd of just welcomed our th child into our family! I couldnapost love this man anymoreI tried. Happy silver wedding anniversary to us. Since those two fresh-faced lovebirds tied the knot they have welcomed a whopping  kids into the world, including another two just since that photo was posted on Facebook, bringing their total to  children and  grandchildren. The celeb couple are parents to Chris, , Sophie, , Chloe, , Jack, , Daniel, , Luke, , Millie, , Katie, , James, , Ellie, , Aimee, , Josh, , Max, , Tillie, , Oscar, , Casper, nine, Hallie, six, Phoebe, five, Archie, four, Bonnie, three, and Heidie, one.  Dad Noel supports the massive brood with his bakery business, The Radford Pie Company, which he launched in . Fans of Channel  show  Kids and Counting have followed the Lancashire based family and the day-to-day work of looking after such an army of kids. The Radfords have revealed that they run up massive weekly grocery bills to feed everyone, getting through four loaves of bread per day, plus  pints of milk per week as well as  toilet rolls. The Radford brood range in age from  all the way down to one-year-old.While some of the older children have moved out and started families of their own, the majority of the Radfords all live in an enormous ten-bedroom house in Morecambe.The huge family, who get around in their own minibus, have a luxury pad with cinema, hot tub and bar in their garden while Sue also has a £K Range Rover she uses when there are fewer kids in toe. title: wetherspoons apologises after customer finds
story: Wetherspoons apologises after customer finds shard of plastic in £. breakfastThe piece of plastic was discovered at the "worst rated" JD Wetherspoons in the North Staffordshire region. With just . stars awarded out of over , google reviews. The customer said that biting into the shard-filled mushroom hasnt put her off coming back in the future.Hannah Hiles made the discovery after ordering the traditional breakfast of fried egg, bacon, sausage, two hash browns and toast - and a refillable coffee for £.ByRob AndrewsSamantha Mordi:,  Mar |comments A customer was left shocked after a bargain breakfast meal at JD Wetherspoons had a large shard of plastic in it.Journalist Hannah Hilesapos expectations werenapost exactly high as she paid a visit to the Newcastle-under-Lyme branch, The Arnold Machin.She had been sent to review it after finding it was the worst-rated branch by Google reviews in Stoke-on-Trent and North Staffordshire. And, seemingly astrue to form, the outlet of the popular pub chain appears to have made a howler as Hannah found the unsavoury ingredient as she bit into a mushroom, StokeOnTrentLive reports.A Spoons spokesman has since apologised for not identying the plastic upon visual inspection.Have your say on this story in the comment section Hannah ordered the fried egg, bacon, sausage, two hash browns and toast - and a refillable coffee for £., Stoke on Trent Live reports. In her review of the meal she said writes that that things took a turn for the worse when she bit into her mushroom. She wrote: As I bit into the mushroom, I felt something hard and sharp in my mouth - and brought out a piece of black plastic. Fortunately, it didnapost cut or scratch me, but it was a bit of an unpleasant surprise. It was impossible to tell where it might have come from as there were no distinguishing marks.  Surpisingly, generous Hannah said the experience has not entirely put her off the outlet. She says staff offered her a refund straight away, after the discovery of the plastic shard which was the size of £ coin. While it wasnapost ideal to discover plastic in my breakfast, I do have to praise the helpfulness and professionalism of the staff, who told me that they would look into where it might have come from, she added. Wetherspoon spokesman Eddie Gershon said the plastic appeared to have come from damage to a plastic tray the mushrooms were stored in.Eddie said: We sincerely apologise that a small piece of plastic was found in the meal. Having investigated the matter with the management team, it is understood that the plastic tray in which the mushrooms were delivered and stored may have sustained damage during transit and, as a result, a small piece of plastic appears to have broken off. In accordance with Wetherspoon’s internal operating procedures, the plastic will be sent to our quality assurance team for examination in order to very that it originated from the delivery tray. Wetherspoon has procedures in place to check all deliveries for signs of damage or foreign bodies. Regrettably, on this occasion, the plastic was not identied upon a visual inspection. We are pleased to note that the customer was happy with the way in which the pub team dealt with the incident. The company wishes to echo the apology provided by the pub staff and looks forward to welcoming the customer back for a meal in one of our pubs in the near future. The North Staffordshire branch has been rated the aposworstapos in the region, gaining just . stars out of , google reviews. news us-news five-unanswered-questions-harry-meghans-"Pregnant Meghan Markle sits in silence in blockbuster Oprah interview clipByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |comments When Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sat down for a tell-all interview with chat show host Oprah Winfrey, nobody could have predicted how explosive it would be.It is exactly a year ago today that the chat was first broadcast on TV in America and later in the UK and around the world. And the highly anticipated interview saw the couple lt the lid on le behind Palace walls and make several shocking allegations about their family. Some of the issues raised by the pair threw up more questions about their time as senior working royals - and despite the past  months, some of these questions still remain... Who is the aposroyal racistapos  One of the most shocking lines from Harry and Meghanaposs bombshell tell-all interview was a claim that Harry had conversations within the royal household about how dark son Archieaposs skin might have been before he was born.During the interview, Meghan refused to say who the conversations had been with, saying it would be very damaging to them. Later in the chat, Harry also said he would never reveal the details of the conversations - although it was later reported the comments were not made by the Queen or the late Duke of Edinburgh. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .After the interview aired, a statement was issued by the Queen, which read: The issues raised, particularly that of race, are concerning. Whilst some recollections may y, they are taken very seriously and will be addressed by the family privately. Harry, Meghan and Archie will always be much-loved family members. Meanwhile, Prince William hit back at the claims and insisted they were very much not a racist family when asked by a reporter. However, the identity of the person alleged to have made the comments is still to be revealed. Who denied Meghan help for her mental health  During the interview, Meghan opened up about her mental health struggles and admitted she had suicidal thoughts during her time in the royal family.She explained how she didnapost want to be alive anymore and when asked directlyshe was thinking of self-harm and having suicidal thoughts at some stage, Meghan replied yes. Meghan says that Harry cradled her when she told him, and he later admitted it sent him to a dark place. When she asked the palace to seek professional help, Meghan said she was told she couldnapost get any - how it is still not known who told Meghan she was not allowed to seek help. What really went on between Meghan and Kate   There were numerous reports that Meghan made the Duchess of Cambridge cry during a bridesmaid dress fitting in the lead up to her wedding to Harry.But during her one-on-one with Oprah, Meghan claimed it was actually Kate that made her cry.Meghan said she has now forgiven Kate, adding that sheaposs a good person and that Kate sent her flowers to apologise for the incident - although gave no details on what sparked the incident, and it is still not known for certain. What caused the rt with William  Before the interview, there had been much speculation about the growing rt between Harry and his older brother William. It was reportedly sparked by Williamaposs concerns over Harryaposs fast-developing relationship with Meghan and the tense row quickly boiled over. The younger prince then claimed in the Oprah interview that his brother was trapped within the royal system - although did not go into detail over what caused their reported feud. Why did Charles stop taking Harryaposs calls  Another bombshell made by Harry came when he said he felt let down by his father Prince Charles and was cut off financially. He also claimed that his dad stopped taking his calls - but there has been no further detail on why this was the case. news us-news prince-harry-spotted-wearing-cowboy-"Prince Harry offers continued support to those suffering in UkraineByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrince Harry made a surprise appearance at a Texas rodeo - and came dressed for the occasion wearing a cowboy hat.Harry was spotted at the Stockyards Rodeo in Fort Worth, Texas, on Saturday - a famous rodeo where contestants ride bulls and take part in roping competitions.He was at the event without we Meghan Markle and was seen chatting to people attending the rodeo and was given a tour of the venue.After the rodeo, Cindy Reid, the Stockyards Championship Rodeo secretary, shared a snap of Harry wearing his cowboy hat at the event at the weekend as he chatted to the crowds. She said: Where was Prince Harry Saturday night  Oooooh, just hanging out behind the bucking chutes at the Stockyards Championship Rodeo!! Loooove it!! Thank you for the visit!! Harryaposs appearance at the rodeo comes two weeks after his and Meghanaposs last public outing at the NAACP Image Awards, where they were awarded the prestigious Presidentaposs Award to mark their special achievement for aposdistinguished public serviceapos.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Accepting the award, Harry said: I think itaposs safe to say that I come from a very dferent background from my incredible we, yet our lives were brought together for a reason. We share a commitment to a le of service, a responsibility to combat injustice and a belief that the most often overlooked are the most important to listen to.  The couple also offered their support to the people of Ukraine amid the Russian invasion and Harry explained: Before I begin, we would like to acknowledge the people of Ukraine, who urgently need our continued support as a global community. Meanwhile, last month, Harry also made another outing without Meghan - to the Super Bowl, where he was joined by his younger cousin Princess Eugenie.The prince, who now lives in the US, took in the game between Los Angeles Rams and Cincinnati Bengals Harry and Eugenie have remained close friends since he decided to up sticks and move his le to the US with Meghan. The couple moved to Calornia in  after dramatically quitting as senior royals and leaving the UK. They now live in Montecito with their children Archie, two, and eight month-old Lilibet. title: clearest ever spooky figure caught
story: Clearest ever spooky figure caught on camera by ghost hunters at haunted jailLinzi and Lee Steer, from Rotherham, who run Project reveal - Ghosts of Britain say their latest capture is the clearest image they have taken in their decades of ghost hunting experienceNumerous visitors have reported spooky phenomena and paranormal activity in the stone cells and passageways of Inveraray JailImage: Getty ImagesByAmber OConnorJoe Smith:,  Mar |commentsGhosts hunters say they have caught their clearest-ever evidence of spooky activity on camera during a recent trip to a haunted site. Linzi and Lee Steer, who run Project reveal - Ghosts of Britain say their latest capture is the clearest image they have taken in their decades of ghost hunting experience. The couple from Rotherham, who have over  years of paranormal research experience between them, have snapped what many of their fans believe is an apparition in the form of a ghostly face.The experienced investigators live stream all their hunts and they were alerted to the spooky visage when fans spotted it on a Facebook clip,Yorkshire Live reports. I just canapost get over it. It is so clear and distinctive, said Linzi. The pair spotted the photo after a visit to Inveraray Jail.The couple, who go on daily ghost hunts, live-stream all of their investigations on Facebook and ask viewers to screenshot any unusual sightings. But when they looked back at the photos from their trip to the Scottish jail and courtroom, they were left shocked. A figure can be seen behind a waxwork model in multiple screenshots, according to Linzi. While she said she could not see the figure while she was filming, she has been left unable to explain what her viewers saw. Linzi said: We try to debunk everything, but thereaposs no dummy there in that particular area.  She added: It is definitely not human. If it was one of us you could tell with the colouring, but it looked very transparent. The apparent figure wasnapost the only spooky part of their trip either. Husband Lee revealed he had an unnerving experience when looking around the siteaposs jail blocks. I walked into one of them and I felt a tickling sensation on my throat, and it started to get more intense to the point where I had to run outside, he said. Although they didnapost know it at the time, the couple were later told by staff that many people have reported feeling a choking sensation in the same spot. Lee added: That is the first time Iaposve ever felt that kind of thing. Iaposm actually sceptical when it comes to ghosts.You can see the screenshots for yourself and see more of the investigatorsapos work here. news weird-news i-tested-five-dferent-brands-"Spilling the tea on what makes the best cuppa ByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Like many people, I drink far too much tea, but rarely stop to consider the dference a decent tea bag can make.After all, Iaposve long been more worried about the atrocities some well-meaning pals can commit with a carton of milk, leaving me battling to taste the leaves through the dairy. Plus, rarely in le do we actually try one type of tea bag directly after the other, unless youaposre at some sort of fancy tea tasting experience, and so itaposs sometimes dficult to discern which brand actually comes out on top. With this in mind, I decided to pit five iconic tea brands against each other, in what I promise is far more than just a very cheeky excuse to nab a particularly y tea break at work.I sampled bags from Tetleyaposs, Yorkshire Tea, PG Tips, Aldiaposs Diplomat Gold Blend and Twinings, ranking each one in terms of all-important factors such as flavour, moreish-ness and, of course, how well they take a good biscuit dunking.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. PG Tips -  ******* £. from the Co-op for  bags of teaFirst things first, I went for a slug of PG Tips fas this has become, for whatever reason, my tried and trusted bag of choice in recent years, a brand which I chuck in the basket without really thinking too much about it.However, this just goes to show that you should branch out every now and then when it comes to your store cupboard staples, with this household name not quite hitting the mark when compared to its fellow tea break giants. PG Tips doesn’t quite pack the same powerful punch as other teas, and I noticed a slightly thin, watery taste when compared with more flavourful options. Despite not making too much of an impact on me, this is still an enjoyable drink, with no lingering unpleasant aftertaste. I also found that the more subtle notes made it ideal for biscuit dipping.Twinings - .  ********   £. Tesco for pack of Being at the pricier end of the spectrum, I would usually only plump for TwiningsI spied it on offer somewhere. Given that it does feel rather more suited to afternoon scones with the Queen than a rushed, microwaved job ahead of mid-week Zoom calls, it doesnapost exactly feel in sync with my day-to-day le.However, that said, this is a very good quality tea, and one that I donapost mind buying every now and then as a special treat. Of course, I had to sip it from my fanciest Jane Austen Museum china cup, like the lady I am and was pleased as ever by the light flavours and comforting toastiness. One of the more distinctive teas on the market, Twinings doesnapost have the same bitterness that spoils so many other products. But it narrowly misses out on the top spot given that the perfumed notes may get a little cloying after a few brew rounds. It felt wrong to submerge a biscuit in this one, but I had a good go anyway.Tetleys - .  ******   £. for  tea bags at Tesco Iaposve never personally been a Tetleyaposs drinker, and canapost say that Iaposve ever bought a bag myself as an adult. However, I have some vague memories of collecting the little figurine men as a kid, so the bag did infuse a bit of nostalgia.Admittedly, I was a little disappointed after going in for a gulp, and have to say that Iaposm somewhat surprised that this brand is as popular as it is, being the leading tea brand in UK convenience and independent grocery stores as of , according to Statistica. To be perfectly honest, I found Tetleyaposs to have quite a bitter, earthy taste which may well take a little getting used to for those used to smoother beverages. There was also quite a gravelly, dentistaposs waiting room-esque aftertaste that I would have expected from a lesser-known, cheaper label. I didnapost bother to dunk.Aldiaposs Diplomat Gold Blend -   ******** p for a pack of  at AldiI love Aldi and do the majority of my recipe shopping there, but this is the first time Iaposve gone for a bag of Aldiaposs own tea.Although I do like to be adventurous with my food, Iaposm a stickler for habit when it comes to tea and coffee brands, and - I must say - Iaposve learned a lesson on this front.I opted for a pack of Aldiaposs Diplomat Gold Blend and was immediately impressed by the pretty scenic packaging, which looks a far cry from what youaposd typically imagine a discount box of tea to look like. However, the most pleasant surprise of all was the quality taste, with mellow, rounded mouthfuls making for a very satisfying - and biscuit-worthy - post-sht pick-me-up. Being by far the best bang for your buck, this makes for a thrty swap likely to please even the pickiest of tea drinkers.  Yorkshire Tea -   ********** £. at the Co-op for  tea bagsAs Iaposve said, Iaposve mostly drunk PG Tips in recent times, but Iaposve previously been a Yorkshire Tea drinker through and through. This taste test made me wonder why Iaposd ever bothered to swap. Classic, hearty, and above all reassuring, Yorkshire Tea is a hardy brew built to weather the ious storms in le, and I knew it wouldnapost disappoint.Strong, yet moreish, flavourful but not overwhelming, this is the tea Iaposd opt for in a desert island scenario, knowing that it comforts me in my loneliest moments. In all honesty, the only reason Iaposm not giving this king of teas a solid ten out of ten is that Iaposm sure thereaposs some independent tea shop in some country village somewhere that might have just pipped it to the post. However,there is, Iaposm yet to find it. After some consideration, there can be no worthier winner than Yorkshire Tea, quite rightly voted as the UKaposs favourite brand last year in a poll by Tea and Coffee .The ever-elegant Twinings was my second runner-up, with Aldiaposs Diplomat Gold Blend coming in a very respectable third. My old go-to PG Tips didnapost quite compare, ranking fourth in the list, while Tetleys was my least favourite of the bunch.Do you have a food or drink-related story to tell  We pay for stories. title: mum gives birth baby weighing
story: Mum gives birth to baby weighing over  pounds - the same as a bowling ballHelen Sellers, , gave birth to one of the biggest babies her midwe had ever seen, as Celia, now five weeks old, was born weighing a whopping lbs oz - the same as a bowling ballHelen Sellers gave birth to baby Celia, who weighed lbs oz Image: Mercury Press  Media Ltd.ByJohn BettAudience WriterBeth Ure:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A mum was stunned after giving birth to a baby girl that weighed a whopping lbs oz - the same as a mid-weight bowling ball. Helen Sellers, , was warned when she was pregnant that her baby looked like she was going to be quite big, but the new mum was still in for a shock.They took bets in the family about how big the baby would be, and Helenaposs cousin guessed lbs which she thought was aposcheekyapos. But then, when baby Celia finally arrived, doctors and midwives were astounded as she weighed in at a staggering lbs oz.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Whataposs the heaviest baby youaposve seen  Let us know in the comments...Helen, from Leeds, Yorkshire, and her husband, Carl, have one other child - Roman, who wasnapost a small baby either as he was born weighing lbs. She said: Carl is ft now, but he wasnapost a big baby, so weaposre not sure why Celia was so big. While I was pregnant, my consultant said that the baby was going to be big, but not as big as Roman. I never expected her to be that weight. We played guess the weight with my family, and my cousin put lbs and I thought that was so cheeky, but he was right! Celia had to go straight into - clothes when she was born, as none of the newborn clothes fit her.  Helen said: I had bought a couple of babygrows that were up to one month, and I didnapost even bother getting them out the packet - I knew they wouldnapost fit her. I had bought some - month stuff, and sheaposs already in - month clothes now. Helen revealed that the midwives had hilarious reactions to Celiaaposs size. She said: I had to have a c section, and it took them ages to get her out. I initially wanted to try natural delivery, but Iaposm glad I didnapost now because Iaposm not sure she would have come out. The midwives were laughing a bit and saying she was really big. She was the talk of the ward, they all wanted to come and look at her because she was so big. My midwe had worked for  years and she said Celia was the second biggest baby sheaposd ever seen.During the pregnancy, Helen had a big bump.She said: My bump was huge, I always had people asking meI was having twins. There was one lady at work who asked me a few timesI was sure it wasnapost twins! The doctors tested me for gestational diabetes but they were negative. title: my pug loves dog across
story: My pug loves the dog across the street - she pines when hes not in his windowOne-year-old Sally spends hours gazing out the window in hopes of catching a glimpse of her love interest - but is an awful mood when he isnt there looking back at her" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Little-dog-looking-through-a-window.jpg" width"" "" The dog is besotted with the golden retriever across the roadImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen it comes to securing a date, one of the most challenging aspects is making a good impression on a prospective partner while filled with nervous energy. Many people opt for a wingman to help them navigate the dating pool on a night out - enabling them to come across as an interesting and exciting person who somebody would want to spend time with.But rather than helping a friend, one woman has been acting as aposwingwomanapos for her one-year-old dog after she fell in love with the dog across the street. Describing her pugaposs one-sided love story on Reddit, the owner explained how her dog, Sally, spends hours gazing out their firth floor flat window in hopes of catching a glimpse of a neighbouring golden retriever.She said: My dog, who is usually scared of everything, is besotted with the dog over the road.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  I have noticed how she always goes to stare out this one window which is directly opposite but one floor down - a golden retriever called Barney lives there. When he is at the window, she just wags her tail while looking at him and he stares back. I canapost seehis tail is wagging too.But when he isnapost there, she pines and sighs. She is in such an awful mood when he isnapost there. Itaposs so sad - I just want to cuddle and console her.The woman explained how Sally and Barney play in the courtyard outside her flats when theyaposre both on a walk at the same time - saying her pug becomes aposjealousapos when the golden retriever approaches other dogs. They spend a lot of time snfing each otheraposs bums and play fighting. Sally always chases after him when Barney goes over to other dogs too, said the woman.  As owners, we havenapost said much about it. Iaposm not sureBarneyaposs owner has noticed how much my dog loves his dog. We are friendly and have joked about it quickly but I donapost think he thought anything of it. Questioning whether it would be weird to ask Barneyaposs owner on a doggy date on behalf of her pug, the woman asked users for their thoughts. While most users agreed she should try to organise a play date for the dogs, others thought it could turn into a great meet cute between the owners too. One user said: I donapost think you would sound like a weirdo at all! It might even be a good opportunity to make a friend. As a dog mum, I would be so excited to hear this and would love to get the dogs together often. Whataposs the worst that could happen  They say no  Oh well. Another user added: That’s so cute! Not weird at all. My dog has a aposboyfriendapos named Charles. They get so excited to see each other that he will drag his owner to my dog and my dog will drag me to him. They’re both fixed so no worries there. I’ve requested play dates and have them fine. When we meet serendipitously, we stop for  minutes to let our dogs play.A third said: Dogs totally find dogs who they love more than anyone . My late dog, Sandwich, and our friendaposs dog, Rihanna, were like soulmates.Neither of us ever saw our respective dogs treat any other dog the way they treated each other. If I hadn’t already been friends with my friends when our dogs became best friends, I think it would have happened as a result. Do you have a cute dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: blind dog worlds longest tongue
story: Blind dog with worlds longest tongue spends  days in kennelsSeven-year-old Bobby has featured as Blind Dog Rescue UKs Dog of the Day nine times over a year and a half - but is yet to secure a new home with owners who can show him what it is to be lovedThe charity want to secure Bobby a new home in the UK Image: Blind Dog Rescue UKByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsHe was callously thrown out onto the street when his owner lost interest in him - but still manages to see the best in people despite everything he has been through. Little Bobby has spent about  days in rescue after being picked up by Blind Dog Rescue UK, who rehome dogs who have been subjected to the aposworst of humanityapos.The seven-year-old dog, who is completely blind, was wandering the streets searching for his former family when the rescue team came across him.A spokesperson said: Meet handsome Bobby with the longest tongue ever. He was used for breeding and the owners said they have purchased another dog of his kind and they threw him on an open road km away from home on purpose.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.When they called him Bobby for the first time he started screaming and searching for his owners - it broke their hearts. Currently living in a private shelter in Macedonia, the team are striving to secure Bobby a new home in the UK, where he can experience love for the first time. Despite featuring as Blind Dog Rescue UKaposs aposDog of the Dayapos nine times over a year and a half, nobody has come forward to offer him a place in their home.One user said on Facebook: Please somebody give this absolutely gorgeous baby his forever home.I canapost take him as we have three furbabies now - two rescues, one from the UK and a little Romania a girl, then an -month-old puppy. Rescue animals give you their undying love.  While another user added: So heartbreaking. There must be a home for him to let him realise he will be loved always. A third said: Such a handsome boy Bobby. I pray you are soon settled in the happy forever home you truly deserve sweetheart. Blind Dog Rescue UK works to rehome blind and partially sighted dogs who have been victims of abuse, neglect, disease or trauma - and struggle to survive in shelters. A statement reads: “It is incredibly dficult for sighted dogs to survive anyof time in these shelters let alone blind or partially sighted dogs. “We need to get to these dogs quickly and secure their immediate release and treatment.  “These dogs may have been deliberately blinded, involved in road traffic accidents or long term sufferers of painful conditions such as glaucoma.“They need veterinary care and to be given the safety and comfort of a foster home in which to start healing. “Here they are given love and affection and a warm bed - possibly the first they will have experienced in their letimes. At this point, we are able to start assessing and promoting these wonderful dogs for forever homes.To adopt Bobby, or find out more information about him, contact Blind Dog Rescue UK via their website www.bdruk.org.Do you have a story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON AnimalsTeamDogsDogs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news world-news captured-russian-commander-begs-forgiveness-"Ukraine: Captured Russian commander begs for forgivenessByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A captured Russian commander has spoken of his “shame” for his involvement in the war in Ukraine, as he begged for forgiveness.Lieutenant Colonel Astakhov Dmitry Mikhailovich said he and his comrades were lied to and understoodhis homeland was hated for the brutal invasion. Speaking during a conference alongside two other captured Russians, he said: “I cannot find the words to say sorry to the Ukrainian people. “I just sincerely hope for your mercy towards those people who come to you with their hands up, or those who are wounded. We should not sow death. Itaposs better to sow le. “I donapost know why we were doing it. We knew very little. We brought sorrow to this land. He added that he was prepared to go to jail for his part in the war on their peaceful neighbours.Follow all todayaposs latest updates on the conflict with our live blog The Lt Col is believed to be the most senior Russian officer to so far speak out against the atrocities levelled at Ukraine since Putin ordered the invasion last month. He told reporters the order had taken him by surprise and that he and his men had been lied to about the situation in Ukraine. The press conference was held last week but was widely shared on Monday. The unprovoked invasion of neighbouring Ukraine by Russian forces on the command of President Vladimir Putin has sparked bloodshed and chaos. With Putinaposs troops shelling cities across Ukraine and the nationaposs army vowing to fight to the death to defend their land, observers fear the death toll will be enormous.On Sunday, February , Ukraineaposs health minister reported that at least  Ukrainian civilians have been killed since the Russian invasion began, and more than , wounded. On March , Ukraine claimed to have killed , Russian soldiers since the start of the invasion. These claims have not yet been independently veried but a human rights monitoring team from the United Nations has confirmed more than  civilian casualties in Ukraine. At least  people have been killed, including  children, a UN report showed on Tuesday. Bachelet, addressing the opening session of the Human Rights Council in Geneva, previously said: Most of these civilians were killed by explosive weapons with a wide impact area, including shelling from heavy artillery and multi-launch rocket systems, and air strikes. The real figures are, I fear, considerably higher. It comes as Ukraineaposs President accused Russia of aposstate terrorismapos on Tuesday after the indiscriminate bombing of Kharkiv.  The prisoner of war added: For those who would watch this video: you might think about me whatever you want, that I was forced, intimidated or the text was prepared in advance, whatever. Iaposll give it to you straight. If someone came to my territory I would do the same [as these] people did.  They[said] aposwe didnapost call you here…I feel shame that we came to this country.“I feel sorry for people left in Russia …they are not guilty. Their guilt is that they are misinformed.Some do not even have internet. They have no chance to use something alternative. They are constantly brain-washed. They get this unilateral information that Ukraine is seized by fascists.Earlier in the war another capturedRussiansoldier begged his mum to tell people the truth about theUkraineinvasion in a heartbreaking phone call.The POW was seen crying as he described how Vladimir Putinaposs forces had bombed kindergartens andhospitals .He told his mum to spread the word of what is really going on back home - where government propaganda is re. In the footage, the soldier is seen rocking back and forth in his chair during the video call. He tells his mum to use social media so as many people as possible know what the Kremlin attacks look like. He said Le has been peaceful here before our president started all of this.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Vladimir PutinRussia Ukraine war" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: devoted dad surprises little girl
story: Devoted dad surprises little girl with tattoo of open-heart surgery scar like hersFour-year-old "little fighter" Everly Backe, of Illinois, USA, has had three open-heart surgeries leaving her with a downward scar in the middle of her chest dubbed her "zipper"Everly Backe pointing at her dad Matts scar tattoo Image: Backe Family   CATERS NEWSByJasmine KazlauskasLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA loving dad surprised his daughter with a tattoo of an open-heart surgery scar that is identical to hers so she would never feel alone.Brave little Everly Backe, four, has already undergone three major open- heart surgeries with her first taking place only three days after she was born. Parents Lauren and Matt, both , learnt of their daughteraposs complex congenital heart defect while she was still in the womb and stayed by her side as she spent the first year of her le undergoing two more open-heart surgeries.The le-saving procedures have left her with a deep downward scar in the middle of her chest, which her parents Lauren and Matt have dubbed her zipper due to it being opened and closed so many times.In the sweetest display of solidarity with his daughter, Matt – who had never been inked before – decided to get a tattoo of an open-heart surgery scar that was identical to Everlyaposs so that they could be zipper buddies for le. Insurance salesmen Matt, from Crystal Lake, Illinois, USA, said: Neither my we or I had ever got a tattoo before, or even really thought about it. It all started because I began noticing Everly was noticing her zipper scar a lot more than usual and was making many comments about it. I realised that she was starting to feel dferent, as there is not a whole lot of representation of scars, especially her type, out there. I just randomly said one day, aposyou know what, Iaposm going to get a tattoo to match her.apos  It was kind of just one of those things you say in passing, and I didnapost think much more about it. But then at Christmas , Laurenaposs parents surprised me with a gt card for a local tattoo artist near us. I was so touched by the gesture. Matt booked a consultation and thought he would go back in a week or two to get his tattoo but the artist had a cancellation. He added: So, all of a sudden, Iaposm getting the tattoo and my we and kids had no idea it was happening right then. It was all just like it was meant to be. It hurt as it was right on the bone, but I was thinking about Evie the whole time. If she could go through everything she has at such a young age, I could get this done. Matt said he was not sure how his daughter would react to his new tattoo orshe would truly understand the meaning behind it.  But when he got home and showed it off, both Matt and Lauren were left in hysterics after she told her dad Youaposre copying me. Matt said: In true Evie fashion, the first thing she said was that I was copying her and was teasing me for it. She is certainly the boss around here and has no qualms about putting people in their place. But I could see how happy she was, and she then smiled and told me that I wanted to have a special heart like hers.Mum-of-two Lauren also got inked for the very first time with a special tribute to her daughteraposs condition - an EKG on her left arm to commemorate all she has been through. She said: Iaposm so incredibly proud of Evie. She has been through so much already and keeps positive throughout it all.She is a very happy little girl and doesnapost really know any dferent. She has no idea what it is like not to be tired all the time and be in and out of hospitals.Evie knows she is a little bit dferent, as she takes a lot more breaks than the other kids and does need to be carried or popped in her stroller at times. But we always said we will let her be as aposnormalapos as her body will allow. We did not fight this hard for this long for her to just be in bed and do nothing. She is a little fighter and surprises us every day with her strength. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The proud parents said Everlyaposs adoring older brother Jack, , has always been there for his little sister through all the ups and downs. The vibrant fourth-grader has also eagerly stated he wants to get a zipper tattoo just like his daddy to support his sis once he turns . Lauren added: Jack absolutely fell in love with his dadaposs tattoo and his first question was aposhow old do you have to be to get one apos He is adamant that he will also get one as soon as he turns . He wants to support his sister. He is the best big brother anyone could ask for and has been since day one. The parents are hoping to raise awareness of childhood congenital heart defects by sharing their inspiring story with the world. After putting a photo of the tattoo on social media, Matt and Lauren said they have been contacted by people from around the globe who have found solace in their story. Matt said: It has been amazing to receive so many positive comments from people all over telling us how our story has touched them. Many were saying how they have always been self-conscious or ashamed of their zipper scars, so seeing posts like these have been amazing. That is all we want to do. We want to help others like Evie feel less alone while also raising awareness of the condition. Lots of kids with CHD donapost make it past their first birthday and more do not make it past . We hope by raising awareness, it will also help increase funding for research to help save lives. news world-news elderly-woman-crosses-bombed-bridge-"Residents of Irpin cross over water around downed debrisByClaire OBoyleAssistant Features Editor Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsWalking stick in hand, the elderly woman gingerly crosses the wreckage of a bridge as she tries to flee her bombed home. The harrowing image captures the terror faced by so many like her but also, the bravery shining through.While many women have taken up arms and are fighting for their country, others are simply fighting to stay alive. And as the onslaught continues, as the world marks International Women’s Day, Ukraine ’s mothers, daughters and sisters continue to show their strength and defiance.The journey ahead for this woman will be long as she escapes, with others from the town of Irpin, on the outskirts of Kyiv, after days of heavy shelling. It is a journey many have already undertaken. Follow the latest updates from Ukraine in our live blog here Mariia Yevdokymova says she has cried only once since the war began. For nine days, along with her mother, younger sister, father and -year-old great-grandmother, the third-year medical student from the historic port city of Odessa, held her nerve at home, determined to stay and face down the Russians. But with growing fears of an aerial bombardment of the city where she grew up, on Saturday the family, with the exception of Mariia’s father who has stayed behind to fight, made the treacherous journey to the border. “It has been dficult,” explains Mariia. “But we have to be strong. I have only cried once since the war began, when we got to Moldova. When we crossed the border and stopped hearing the bombs and the sirens. When we couldn’t hear those sounds any more I suddenly cried. I realised what had happened. Now though, I feel stronger again. I will be strong for my family and our country. Our future is very unclear but when all this is over, we will be back to rebuild.”As the world marks International Women’s Day, the strength of Mariia and the women of Ukraine has been breathtaking. The many stories of their acts of defiance, courage and compassion have brought people across the globe to a standstill, from the hundreds of thousands who have made exhausting and perilous journeys to bring their families to safety in bordering countries like Poland, Romania and Hungary, to the millions more striving to keep their loved ones safe at home as Russian shells and bullets rain down.As Russian authorities clamp down on information, outlawing the very use of the word war in relation to their barbaric invasion of their next-door neighbour, Ukrainian First Lady Olena Zelenskais fighting to make sure ordinary people in Russia learn the truth. In a powerful post to her . million Instagram followers as she shared heartbreaking pictures of Ukrainian children who have been killed in attacks, she wrote: “When people in Russia say that their troops are not hurting the civilian population, show them these pictures! Show them the faces of these children who weren’t even given a chance to grow up.” She added: “Show these photos to Russian women - your husbands, brothers, compatriots are killing Ukrainian children!” Right across the country and from many walks of le, women have taken up arms, bolstering the tens of thousands already working with Ukraine’s armed forces. MP Kira Rudik tweeted a picture of herself holding a Kalashnikov the day after war broke out. “I’m so angry right now,” she later said. “I’m a woman, I have to bear arms and fight the tyrannies of those who want to take what is ours. When you are very angry, there is no place for the fear, I will be afraid afterwards. Right now I will have to get very strong, train and make sure that we have all of the supplies we need.” Fellow MP Lesia Vasylenko, whose three children have been evacuated from their home in the capital Kyiv, told how she kept her weapon with her at all times, saying: “I sleep with it, I work with it, I go to the bathroom with it, do I have a choice  No I don’t have a choice.” Beauty Queen Anastasia Lenna, who represented her country in the  Miss Grand International beauty contest, has also signed up to fight. She wrote on her Instagram page: “Nobody can stop new le! Nobody can stop us! Every day our woman bring new babies. Our nation is powerful and strong! I dedicate my time to volunteering for my country.” And while many have made their way out of Ukraine to safety, others have made their way back to join the fight.Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Mother-of-two Yulia Peliukh-Korniichuk, who along with her husband moved to the Czech Republic in January for work, leaving their children in Ukraine with family, ed last week. “I want to see my children,” said Yulia. “I want to see my mother.” And while she vowed to take up arms to fight for her country, Yulia said conflict was not what she wanted. “I want peace,” she said. “I don’t want war... I don’t want to die our soldiers , our Ukrainian soldiers. They are very brave. And also Ukrainian women are brave with them and I think that we will be OK. We will win.”Preparations to fight were underway even before Russia’s invasion, with -year-old Valentyna Konstantynovska from Mariupol attending military training earlier in February. Valentyna, who was taught how to use an AK- assault rle by the Ukrainian national guard, said: “I’m ready to shootsomething happens. I will defend my home, my city, my children.” Grandmother Raisa Smatko showed her support for the defence effort by preparing Molotov cocktails for the fighters. The retired economist said she was prepared to defend her part of Kyiv district against invaders, saying: “We are ready to greet them.” With people using any and all means available to fight back against the Russians, Liubov Tsybulska, an advisor to the Ukranian government, reported that a woman had managed to bring down a Russian drone with a jar of pickled cucumbers launched from her balcony. “Ukrainian women are strong and resourceful,” says Mariia. “Partly because of our Soviet Union past, where everyone had to work, it’s very common for Ukrainian women to be the matriarch, the leader in their family. Throughout my le I’ve been told to be strong and to work hard to succeed. We are tough, and all that will pay off for us. We are especially tough now.” They are compassionate too.Nataliya Ableyeva, , brought a stranger’s children to safety in Hungary where they were reunited with their mother after border guards stopped their father from leaving Ukraine. “Their father simply handed over the two kids to me, and trusted me, giving me their passports to bring them over,” she said. Helping where of course are the emergency services, risking their lives to help both fighters and civilians. Paramedic Valentyna Pushych paid the ultimate price when she was shot on her way to evacuate injured people from the outskirts of the capital. She was buried on Saturday. Doctor Marina Kalabina was killed last week when her car came under fire as she took her wounded nephew to a hospital in the village of Kukhari in Kyiv.And as Ukraine’s brave women each play their part, for now Mariia, whose great-grandmother lived through World War Two, is focused on her family and hopes to reach out soon to her young students still living under threat from Russia. “We are all doing our best to support one another,” says Mariia. “Before we left Ukraine my family and I cooked broth and pies for the territorial defence and brought them clothes and blankets, whatever we could find to help. We have now left as things were getting so dangerous, but many of my students have stayed in Odessa. Last week I ran an online English class for them as a distraction from everything that was going on. It helped. Once I have secure internet again I will try to pick that up again. We need to stay focused and strong and remember who we are. Ukraine will come through this, soon I hope, and we have to be ready.” A sense of Ukraine’s extraordinary spirit of strength and defiance was conveyed on day one of the war when footage of a woman walking fearlessly towards a heavily armed Russian soldier was shared on social media s around the world, as she demanded to know: “What the f*** are you doing in our land with all these guns ” calling Russian troops “occupiers” and “enemies”. Stunned onlookers filmed as she fearlessly confronted the soldier in the port city of Henichesk, berating him as he and others tried to talk her down. Using the powerful symbol of her country’s national flower as she challenged him, she said: “Take these seeds and put them in your pockets so at least sunflowers will grow when you all lie down here.” That remarkable courage has carried on ever since, with President Zelensky’s we Olena last week reflecting Ukraine’s dignity and unstoppable fighting spirit as she addressed her two million followers on Instagram. “Today I will not have panic and tears,” she wrote. “I will be calm and confident. My children are looking at me. I will be next to them. And next to my husband. And with you.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsSoldiersRussia Ukraine warInternational Womens Day" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: international womens day 2022 7
story: International Womens Day :  things remarkable women have invented through historyAs the world celebrates this years International Womens Day, we take a look back at some of the most important and revolutionary inventions by women throughout historyInternational Womens Day is recognising the achievements of women around the world Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Mar |commentsInternational Womenaposs Day is upon us once again with the celebration of female achievement taking place around the world. The United Nations has formally acknowledged the day since  as a recognition of the struggle for womenaposs rights.The UN said: The year  is pivotal for achieving gender equality in the context of climate change, and environmental and disaster risk reduction, which are some of the greatest global challenges of the twenty-first century. Without gender equality today, a sustainable future, and an equal future, remains beyond our reach. It estimates that % of the . billion people living in conditions of poverty are women. Over the years, feminist movements have drawn attention to the need to redress the balance both within the workplace, socially, and in terms of how we think about the recognition of womenaposs contribution to the furthering of our society. Radical developments in engineering, science and general appliances have dramatically changed the face of the world we live in, but many would argue they are not as well recognised as they should be. Often, some of the best inventions go unnoticed, despite their use in our everyday lives. Who invented Kevlar   Kevlar was invented by Stephanie L. Kwolek, a Delware-based chemist. The material is used in bulletproof vests and other protective equipment, with its main features being that it is both light and strong.  It has saved countless lives over the years and is familiar to war reporters and soldiers. Kowelek patented the process of making Kevlar in . Who was Bessie Blount Grfin   The brilliant Bessie Blount Grfin was an American physical therapist known for working with soldiers during the first world war and inventing the feeding tube. Many soldiers became amputees due to the fighting and Blount noticed that much of the equipment was poor or inadequate. In her therapies, she taught amputees alternative ways of using their limbs, including people who lost their arms learning to use their mouths to write and their feet for general tasks.  Her invention of the feeding tube stands out the most, however, and meant that a tube inserted into the patientaposs mouth allowed them to eat independently and comfortably. Her aposportable receptacle support” was patented in  and the rights were bought by the French government one year later.After this, Blount went on to invent a disposable cardboard vomit basin, still standard in Belgian hospitals today according to Black Past.The History website argues she may well have been the first black woman to train at Scotland Yard’s Document Division, after moving into a career in forensics. Who was Ada Lovelace and what did she invent   The first computer algorithm is credited to pioneer mathematician Ada Lovelace. The daughter of poet Lord Byron, Ada built on the work by Italian mathematician Luigi Menabrea to formulate a code so elaborate and with such great depth that she is referred to as “the first computer programmer”.  Mathematician Anna Sfert from the Max Planck Institute for Mathematics said: If Ada had not written the first computer programme, someone  would have done it. The signicance of her work lies in the fact that she was the first to do so - a century before the invention of the computer. One-handed syringe  Letitia Mumford Greer patented the use of a one-handed syringe. Before this, a two-handed syringe was widely used by physicians.As the world continued to fight the coronavirus pandemic with a syringe or two, her invention was ahead of its time. The syringe did not initially become widely used when it was invented, as most drugs could not be injected, but the inventionaposs relevance grew and grew.Who invented the retractable dog leash  For people who have not had to follow their dog into the bushes to be greeted with all manner of unwanted substances, they can thank inventor Mary A. Delaney. In her own words, the intention was to stop our four-legged friends from running on the wrong side of lamp posts or pedestrians, thus causing much annoyance to the owner. Who invented the windscreen wiper   Crazy as it may seem, Mary Andersonaposs invention of windscreen wipers was not always standard on cars. She notice in a visit to New York City in  that passengers would get cold every time the driver opened the door to slip the window down, so set about inventing a new way of clearing the windscreen from inside the car.  Mary never profited from the invention, originally dismissed by car companies. What is stem cell isolation   Ann Tsukamoto was part of the team that found the first method of isolating blood-forming stem cells in . There is a huge amount of medical research into stem cells and they have been used in therapies for well over  years. Found in the bone marrow, stem cells are vital to cancer research. The University of Nebraska said: Research on stem cells continues to advance knowledge about how an organism develops from a single cell and how healthy cells replace damaged cells in adult organisms. news world-news russian-troops-beg-home-amid-"Ukraine: Demoralised Russian soldiers beg for homeByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Demoralised Russian troops shocked at the sight of so many corpses begged to go home in intercepted calls from the frontline.In the intercepted calls, soldiers said the war in Ukraine could last months, despite Vladimir Putin saying it would be over in two weeks.Another infantryman said his battalion did not have any food left, with troops raiding a nearby supermarket for supplies. Ukrainian politician Anton Herashchenko, advisor at the Ministry of Internal Affairs, shared translations of the phone calls online. It comes after captured Russian troops complained about being deceived by Putin in a string of videos released by Ukraine. Follow the latest updates from Ukraine in our live blog here  In one intercepted conversation shared by Mr Herashchenko, a Russian soldier reportedly moans: We have no aviation, no f***ing support, we are like cannon fodder. According to the Sun, he added that he would do anything to come back home... resign from the army, I donapost give a f***. The soldier revealed that his comrades were looking forward to the end of the war as fighting for no reason had f***ed everyone up.  In another leaked recording, a Russian infantryman complained that his battalion was facing massacres and said his comrades were shaking, afraid and refusing to fight.A third soldier called his we, it is claimed, and told her:Russia itself attacked Ukraine, why I donapost understand. Weaposre definitely here until May, thataposs for certain.He warned the war could drag on for a couple of years.  Another Russian fighter said he was being paid £ a day - a relatively high wage in Russia - but said no-one cared about the money anymore. He echoed other soldiersapos wishes to quit the army and said his comrades were sleeping in the street. Weaposre running out of diesel fuel, ammunition level is low too. I donapost know what the f*** weaposre going to do, he added.  Russian forces have lost , troops a-day to a ferocious defence from Ukrainian troops and defiant citizen warriors, according to official Ukrainian numbers. The loss of , soldiers, sailors and airmen by day  of the invasion has been a massive blow to Moscow, which is now calling up reserves. Defence experts usually calculate invading commanders usually need an advantage in numbers of around three to one to attack a defending force.  Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter In house to house combat in inner cities, which is what Moscow is attempting, this calculation can be as many as four to one needed.It is estimated that Russia began the invasion with around , troops, in Belarus to the north, on the eastern flank and offshore in the Black Sea.  That is only a few thousand more than Ukraine ’s entire armed forces, it is believed, but the defenders were better-trained.And by adopting a full-on assault offensive on towns and cities that are well defended by a well-motivated force the Russian troops are now mired in urban combat.
